intro: Senecio magellanicus, commonly known as the Magellanic groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators.
